text: Could you get me an example of what a thesis paper for SCAD looks like? I never had to write one so I'm unfamiliar with what should be covered in one.
nm. I found some online. Going to take a look at some of them over the next couple days.

I'm glad you were able to find some examples, to provide more context; I have linked below the SCAD Library Graduate Thesis Archive. In the SCAD Library, you can search by department or program by merely typing "Houdini Thesis," "Visual Effect Graduate Thesis," or any other keywords.

<https://scad.summon.serialssolutions.com/?#!/search?ho=t&l=en&q=visual%20effects%20thesis>


<https://ecollections.scad.edu/iii/cpro/CollectionViewPage.external?lang=eng&sp=1000005&suite=def>

Yeah those are the ones I found. I was taking a little peak at the one for airfield creation, and I think they where doing a different thing than what I was thinking about. But I'm gonna take a more in depth look over the next couple days.
Also there seems to be a lot of padding in these papers.
